fields.Title of Contribution: “Scanner Parameter Estimation Using Bilevel Scans of Star Charts”
fields.Name of Conference: International Conference on Document Analysis and Recognition (ICDAR 2001)
fields.Description/Abstract:
Scanning a high contrast image in bilevel mode results in
image degradation. This is caused by two primary effects:
blurring and thresholding. This paper expands on a
method of estimating a joint distortion parameter, called
the edge spread, from a star sector test chart in order to
calculate the values of the point spread function width and
binarization threshold. This theory is also described for
variations in the source pattern which can represent
degradations caused by repetition of the bilevel process as
would be seen in printing then scanning, or in repeated
photocopying. Estimation results are shown for the basic
and extended cases.
